intro: Weinmannia trianae, commonly known as the Trianas weinmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cunoniaceae. It is native to the Andes Mountains of South America, specifically in regions of Ecuador and Peru. This plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in humid, cool environments at high altitudes. The plant is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
